meanings.sent1: The parallactic view of the stars changed as we moved.
meanings.sent2: The parallactic measurement helped us understand the distance of the object.
meanings.sent3: The parallactic effect made the tree look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: Her parallactic gaze shifted from one side of the room to the other.
meanings.sent5: The parallactic shift in perspective revealed hidden details.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the apparent displacement of an object due to a change in the observer's position
meanings.sent1: The parallactic movement of the moon was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The parallactic shift in the image was caused by the change in angle.
meanings.sent3: The parallactic illusion made the building appear closer than it was.
meanings.sent4: His parallactic explanation clarified why the mountain seemed to move.
meanings.sent5: The parallactic effect created a sense of depth in the painting.

meanings.sent1: The parallactic stars in the sky seemed to twinkle with joy.
meanings.sent2: The parallactic display of the planets amazed the astronomers.
meanings.sent3: The parallactic motion of the car made it look like it was dancing.
meanings.sent4: The parallactic shift in the image revealed hidden details.
meanings.sent5: The parallactic view through the telescope was mesmerizing.
